description: If your from Windows 7, this is most likely the one you want. Only downside, you can't change the color (only yellow background).

I like the way it works. I wanted something to 
remind me to do things so I don't forget. At
66, I need a lot of reminders. This program 
is mighty helpful.

Absolutely worthless. Spent an hour taking notes on specific part numbers I need to order, and the tasks that I need to do. When I start up the computer the next day... gone! Tried re-starting the notes app, NO NOTES!

Don't waste your time.
summary: Worthless! Deletes your notes! NO way to save them!

description:
I am glad that I decided to test this out before actually using it. I wrote a few lines into the app and then closed it. I started the app again, and the notes were gone.

I do not see the point of this app. Notemaking apps are meant to *retain* what I write, even when they are closed. I could just use Gedit.
No UI, no menu, no option to keep notes saved after quitting the app. Who thought this "design" is a good idea? SMH
Can't save your notes, so forget about closing the app. Not other options to do anything.
It's great except that it doesn't save any of the notes after you close/ shutdown.
If you're going to make an app that takes in user data but saves nothing, at least make that prominent in the description.
Has a drag animation and a resizable window (unlike KNotes)
it is a text editor which is open all the time on screen. It is not a sticky note
summary: Like a text editor not a sticky notes

description: its not a stick notes. its just an editor

Just wanted to do a review to address some issues mentioned by prior reviews, namely, the user's experiencing loss of notes and also, the inability to change colors of the note.

If you visit the app's website, and read up on it, it will tell you all of these things, however, they are *not* mentioned in the information that is shown w/in Software Center, which the dev should probably address this and include it in the description that is listed w/in Software Center.

This app does *NOT* have an auto-save function. So, if you type up notes, and close the app, restart your computer, or do anything else at all ... and you don't physically, manually save your notes ... they will not be there when you open the app back up. To save your notes easily and quickly, press "CTRL + S" on your keyboard. 

Regarding changing the note's colors ... this is possible, but you have to edit the source code. See the website for the app for more info on how to do this and a few other "hacks". The website is https://rhinote.tuxfamily.org/screenshots.html

Other than these things, I have downloaded and started to use this app and find it a great addition to my Linux desktop. Even better, it's written in Python which is a language I am beginning to study, so maybe I will be able to help contribute to the app some day. For now, I am just happy to find a sticky notes app that works well and is very simple, without a bunch of extra bells and whistles!
summary: **PSA:** no auto-save feature! (and changing note's color)

description: The notes are not saved. When you shut down your PC and you turn it on, the memos are missing.

For what I do I need to be able to jot down temporary notes as I toggle back and forth through the applications I use and it serves this task well. I know some people complain that it does not retain a history of your notes between times their computer is logged off. If that's what you are looking for then use Ubuntu's built-in text editor and save your notes, but for just a quick file to write down temporary notes, this works well.
Sirve para tener notas en escritorio pero temporales, todo lo que escribo no se guarda, si cierro la aplicacion se pierde la nota que habia escrito.

Las notas desaparecen al reiniciar el PC,
así que no tiene mucho sentido espa aplicaión
summary: Las notas desaparecen al reiniciar el PC

description: Не знаю, почему такая маленькая оценка, какие ожидания липкая заметка должна не оправдать, чтобы снизить оценку. Все супер, мне нравится
